Childhood is the best time of life
code:
Part 1: Verb Tenses (4 points)
Complete the sentences using the correct form of the verb in parentheses.
1. She usually Respuesta 1 Pregunta 1 (to check) her emails in the morning.
2. At the moment, I Respuesta 2 Pregunta 1 (to read) an article about the impact of social media.
3. They Respuesta 3 Pregunta 1 (to finish) the report yesterday.
4. By the time the meeting started, I Respuesta 4 Pregunta 1 (to send) the email to the client.
5. Next year, I Respuesta 5 Pregunta 1 (to attend) a conference on communication technologies.
6. I Respuesta 6 Pregunta 1 (to work) on my project when my internet connection failed.
7. We Respuesta 7 Pregunta 1 (to develop) a new app by the end of this month.
8. Tomorrow at this time, I Respuesta 8 Pregunta 1 (to present) our findings at the meeting.
Retroalimentación
Parcialmente correcta
Puntos para este envío: 3,00/4,00. Contando con los intentos anteriores, daría 3,50/4,00.
Pregunta 2
Correcta
Se puntúa 2,00 sobre 2,00
Marcar pregunta
Enunciado de la pregunta
Part 2: Vocabulary (2 points) Match each term related to technology communication with its correct definition.
The use of various forms of communication, such as text, audio, and video.
Respuesta 1 Pregunta 2 A. Cloud Computing B. Multimedia C. Social Media D. Digital Literacy.
Platforms like Facebook and Twitter that allow users to interact and share content.
Respuesta 2 Pregunta 2 A. Cloud Computing B. Multimedia C. Social Media D. Digital Literacy.
The ability to understand and use digital tools effectively.
Respuesta 3 Pregunta 2 A. Cloud Computing B. Multimedia C. Social Media D. Digital Literacy.
The technology that allows data to be stored and accessed remotely on the internet.
Respuesta 4 Pregunta 2 A. Cloud Computing B. Multimedia C. Social Media D. Digital Literacy.
Retroalimentación
Correcta
Puntos para este envío: 2,00/2,00.
Pregunta 3
Correcta
Se puntúa 2,00 sobre 2,00
Marcar pregunta
Enunciado de la pregunta
Read the following text and answer the questions below.
Text:
In today's world, technological communication plays a crucial role in both personal and professional environments. The ability to communicate effectively using digital tools is a key skill for success. One of the most important aspects of technological communication is the use of multimedia, which combines text, video, and audio to convey messages more effectively. Cloud computing is another essential element, enabling users to store and access information from anywhere, at any time. As we become more reliant on digital tools, having strong digital literacy is essential to navigate the complex digital world.
Retroalimentación
La respuesta correcta es:
What does "cloud computing" allow users to do? → It allows users to store and access information from anywhere.,
According to the text, why is technological communication important? → It plays a crucial role in both personal and professional environments.,
What are two key elements of technological communication mentioned in the text? → Multimedia and cloud computing.,
What combines text, video, and audio to convey messages more effectively? → multimedia
Correcta
Puntos para este envío: 2,00/2,00.
Pregunta 4
Finalizado
Se puntúa 2,00 sobre 2,00
Marcar pregunta
Enunciado de la pregunta
Part 4: Short Answer (2 points)
Write a short paragraph (100-120 words) explaining how technological communication has changed the way we interact with others. Include examples of tools or platforms you use regularly.
Texto de la respuesta Pregunta 4
Technological communication has drastically transformed how we interact,bridging geographical gaps and enabling instant connectivity. In the past, professional and personal exchanges were sloweb and location-dependent.
Today, tools like WhatsApp allow for inmediate personal updates, while platforms such as Microsoft Teams or Zoom have revolutionized professional collaboration, making remote work viable. As an engineering student, I also use Discord and GitHub to coordinate projects and share code in real time.
Although this shift has reduced face-to-face contact, it has undeniably increased efficiency and global accessibility, allowing us to maintain relationships and work flows regardless of physical distance.
Consequently, mastering these digital channelsl is now a fundamental requirement for any successful engineer.
CLE 2 Feedback U2Final del formulario
Pregunta 1
Correcta
Se puntúa 1,00 sobre 1,00
Marcar pregunta
Enunciado de la pregunta
Memories shape who we are. Reflecting on past experiences often evokes emotions—sometimes nostalgia, other times regret or even joy. Many people find themselves reminiscing about their childhood, recalling carefree days spent playing outside, exploring the world with a sense of wonder that can be difficult to recapture as adults. The smell of a particular dish might remind someone of family gatherings, while an old song may transport them back to a school dance or a summer holiday.
Memories have the power to influence our decisions. People often compare current situations to past experiences, using what they learned from previous successes or failures to guide their actions. A person who once failed at a job interview may remember the mistakes they made and use that experience to prepare better for the next opportunity. Similarly, a joyful memory, like winning a sports match, can motivate someone to pursue their goals, believing that such moments of success are possible again.
However, memories are not always reliable. Our brains do not record everything perfectly, and often we unconsciously alter details. Sometimes we remember situations differently from how they happened, influenced by our feelings or the passage of time. The way we perceive an event changes depending on our present emotions. For instance, a person may look back at a challenging period and remember it more positively if they feel they have grown as a result.
The power of memory is not just personal; it also shapes our relationships. Recalling shared experiences strengthens connections with friends and family. Telling stories about "the good old days" brings people closer and helps create a shared sense of identity. Ultimately, our memories, both real and reconstructed, help shape our sense of self and the bonds we form with others.

q: How can memories strengthen relationships?
options: By helping people forget shared experiences
By creating conflicts over different perspectives
By recalling and sharing past experiences

code:
Memories shape who we are. Reflecting on past experiences often evokes emotions—sometimes nostalgia, other times regret or even joy. Many people find themselves reminiscing about their childhood, recalling carefree days spent playing outside, exploring the world with a sense of wonder that can be difficult to recapture as adults. The smell of a particular dish might remind someone of family gatherings, while an old song may transport them back to a school dance or a summer holiday.
Memories have the power to influence our decisions. People often compare current situations to past experiences, using what they learned from previous successes or failures to guide their actions. A person who once failed at a job interview may remember the mistakes they made and use that experience to prepare better for the next opportunity. Similarly, a joyful memory, like winning a sports match, can motivate someone to pursue their goals, believing that such moments of success are possible again.
However, memories are not always reliable. Our brains do not record everything perfectly, and often we unconsciously alter details. Sometimes we remember situations differently from how they happened, influenced by our feelings or the passage of time. The way we perceive an event changes depending on our present emotions. For instance, a person may look back at a challenging period and remember it more positively if they feel they have grown as a result.
The power of memory is not just personal; it also shapes our relationships. Recalling shared experiences strengthens connections with friends and family. Telling stories about "the good old days" brings people closer and helps create a shared sense of identity. Ultimately, our memories, both real and reconstructed, help shape our sense of self and the bonds we form with others.

q: Identify the correct WH-question for asking about someone's preferences:
options: What do you like to do in your free time?
How many times have you travelled by plane?
Where did you go last weekend?
What did you do last weekend?

q: Choose the correct yes/no question to inquire about someone's experience:
options: Did you ever been to Paris?
You never go to Paris, don't you?
Have you never been to Paris?
Have you ever been to Paris?

q: Which sentence follows the zero conditional structure?
options: If you heat ice, it melts.
If you heat ice, it will melt.
If you heat ice, it would melt.
If you heated ice, it would melt.

q: Which sentence correctly uses the present continuous?
Which sentence uses Future Continuous correctly?
options: I studied at this time tomorrow.
I will be studying at this time tomorrow.
I have been studying at this time tomorrow.
I am studying at this time tomorrow.

q: Choose the correct yes/no question:
options: Have you known what time it is?
Do you know what time is it?
Do you know what time it is?
you know what time it is?
